body_html: --define=using_mkl=true must be added when using bazel to build, sometimes you need to clean /path/to/tensorflow/third_party/mkl first(remove .so file), I added /path/to/tensorflow/third_party/mkl to LD_LIBRARY_PATH in ~/.bash_profile.
body_text: --define=using_mkl=true must be added when using bazel to build, sometimes you need to clean /path/to/tensorflow/third_party/mkl first(remove .so file),  I added /path/to/tensorflow/third_party/mkl to LD_LIBRARY_PATH in ~/.bash_profile.
body: `--define=using_mkl=true` must be added when using bazel to build, sometimes you need to clean `/path/to/tensorflow/third_party/mkl` first(remove `.so` file),  I added `/path/to/tensorflow/third_party/mkl` to `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` in `~/.bash_profile`.
